sap.ui.unified.CalendarAppointment.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new CalendarAppointment. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getTentative tentative} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSelected selected} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getKey key} : string
    • {@link #getColor color} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange#constructor sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange} can be used as well.

setText.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getText text}. Text of the appointment. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sText: type: string, description: New value for property text

setTentative.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTentative tentative}. Indicates if the icon is tentative. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bTentative: type: boolean, description: New value for property tentative

getIcon.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getIcon icon}.

Icon of the Appointment. (e.g. picture of the person)

URI of an image or an icon registered in sap.ui.core.IconPool.

setKey.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getKey key}. Can be used as identifier of the appointment When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sKey: type: string, description: New value for property key

setColor.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getColor color}. Overrides the color derived from the type property. This property will work only with full hex color with pound symbol, e.g.: #FF0000. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sColor: type: sap.ui.core.CSSColor, description: New value for property color

getText.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getText text}.

Text of the appointment.

parameters.sIcon: type: sap.ui.core.URI, description: New value for property icon

sap.ui.unified.calendar.Month.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new calendar/Month. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDate date} : object
    • {@link #getIntervalSelection intervalSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSingleSelection singleSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowHeader showHeader} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFirstDayOfWeek firstDayOfWeek} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getNonWorkingDays nonWorkingDays} : int[]
    • {@link #getPrimaryCalendarType primaryCalendarType} : sap.ui.core.CalendarType
    • {@link #getSecondaryCalendarType secondaryCalendarType} : sap.ui.core.CalendarType
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getShowWeekNumbers showWeekNumbers} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSelectedDates selectedDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateRange[]
    • {@link #getSpecialDates specialDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange[]
    • {@link #getDisabledDates disabledDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateRange[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.unified.CalendarLegend)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:focus focus} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

attachFocus.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:focus focus} event of this sap.ui.unified.calendar.Month. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.unified.calendar.Month itself. Date focus changed
attachFocus.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.unified.calendar.Month

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.unified.calendar.Month itself

getDate.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getDate date}.

A date as JavaScript Date object. The month including this date is rendered and this date is focused initially (if no other focus is set).

Valid values inside the array are 0 to 6. If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

nonWorkingHours.!description: If set, the provided hours are displayed as non-working hours. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 23. (Other values will just be ignored.) Note: The non working hours are only visualized if intervalType is set to hour.

endDate.!description: End date for a date range. If empty only a single date is presented by this DateRange element. This must be a JavaScript date object.

maxVisibleItems.!description: The maximum number of items which are displayed before an overflow mechanism takes effect. A value smaller than 1 means an infinite number of visible items. The overall height of the menu is limited by the height of the screen. If the maximum possible height is reached, an overflow takes effect, even if the maximum number of visible items is not yet reached.

mimeType.!description: The chosen files will be checked against an array of mime types. If at least one file does not fit the mime type restriction the upload is prevented. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9. Example: mimeType ["image/png", "image/jpeg"].

orientation.!description: Whether to show the secondary content on the left ("Horizontal", default) or on the top ("Vertical").

singleSelection.!description: If set, only a single date or interval, if intervalSelection is enabled, can be selected Note: Selection of multiple intervals is not supported in the current version.

animation.!description: Set the used animation when changing content. This just sets a CSS-class named "sapUiUnifiedACSwitcherAnimation" + this value on the root element of the control. The animation has to be implemented in CSS. This also enables applications to implement their own animations via CSS by reacting to the parent class. See the types sap.ui.unified.ContentSwitcherAnimation for default implementations.

pageSize.!description: The keyboard can be used to navigate through the items of a menu. Beside the arrow keys for single steps and the Home / End keys for jumping to the first / last item, the Page Up / Page Down keys can be used to jump an arbitrary number of items up or down. This number can be defined via the pageSize property. For values smaller than 1, paging behaves in a similar way to when using the Home / End keys. If the value equals 1, the paging behavior is similar to that of the arrow keys.

image.!description: An image of the user, normally a URI to an image but also an icon from the sap.ui.core.IconPool is possible.

intervals.!description: Number of displayed intervals. The size of the intervals is defined with intervalType

pickerPopup.!description: If set, the day-, month- and yearPicker opens on a popup

secondaryCalendarType.!description: If set, the days are also displayed in this calendar type If not set, the dates are only displayed in the primary calendar type

buttonOnly.!description: If set to "true", the FileUploader will be rendered as Button only, without showing the InputField.

iconSelected.!description: Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is selected (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base or hovered icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

sap.ui.unified.!helpDescription: Unified controls intended for both, mobile and desktop scenarios

headerVisible.!description: If set to false, no header (and no items, search, ...) is shown.

valueState.!description: Defines the value state of the text field of the item. This allows you to visualize e.g. warnings or errors.

withCredentials.!description: Determines the value of the XMLHttpRequest.withCredentials property

startDate.!description: Start date for a date range. This must be a JavaScript date object.

sameFilenameAllowed.!description: If the FileUploader is configured to upload the file directly after the file is selected it is not allowed to upload a file with the same name again. If a user should be allowed to upload a file with the same name again this parameter has to be "true". A typical use case would be if the files have different paths.

searchVisible.!description: If set to false, the search area (aggregation 'search') is hidden. If a custom header is set this property has no effect.

mode.!description: Determines the color mode of the ColorPicker.

currency.!description: Determines the displayed currency code (ISO 4217). Note: If a * character is set instead of currency code, only the character itself will be rendered, ignoring the value property.

intervalSelection.!description: If set, interval selection is allowed

firstDayOfWeek.!description: If set, the first day of the displayed week is this day. Valid values are 0 to 6. If not a valid value is set, the default of the used locale is used.

iconFirst.!description: If set to true (default), the display sequence is 1. icon 2. control text.

groupAppointmentsMode.!description: Defines the mode in which the overlapping appointments are displayed. Note: This property takes effect, only if the intervalType of the current calendar view is set to sap.ui.unified.CalendarIntervalType.Month. On phone devices this property is ignored, and the default value is applied.

fileType.!description: The chosen files will be checked against an array of file types. If at least one file does not fit the file type restriction the upload is prevented. Example: ["jpg", "png", "bmp"].

showCurtainPane.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.3 Curtain is deprecated and replaced by ShellOverlay mechanism.
Shows / Hides the side pane on the curtain.

startsSection.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.18 Dividers are not supported anymore.
If set to true, a divider is displayed before the item.

appointmentsVisualization.!description: Defines the visualization of the CalendarAppoinment Note: The real visualization depends on the used theme.

valueStateText.!description: Custom text for the value state message pop-up. Note: If not specified, a default text, based on the value state type, will be used instead.

sap.ui.unified.!description: Unified controls intended for both, mobile and desktop scenarios

days.!description: number of days displayed on phones the maximum rendered number of days is 8.

minDate.!description: Minimum date that can be shown and selected in the Calendar. This must be a JavaScript date object. Note: If the minDate is set to be after the maxDate, the maxDate is set to the end of the month of the minDate.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised. See {@link sap.ui.core.Control#attachValidateFieldGroup}.

maximumFileSize.!description: A file size limit in megabytes which prevents the upload if at least one file exceeds it. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

showMarker.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.18 Markers should not be used anymore.
If set to true, a theme dependent marker is shown on the item.

maxPrecision.!description: Defines the space that is available for the precision of the various currencies.

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). See {@link sap.ui.core.RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData} for details.

activeContent.!description: The number of the currently active content (1 or 2).

toggleEnabled.!description: If set to true, the item represents a toggle button. The selected property can the be used to define the toggle state. Otherwise the item is displayed as action button. In this case the selected property is ignored.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

uploadOnChange.!description: If set to "true", the upload immediately starts after file selection. With the default setting, the upload needs to be explicitly triggered.

secondaryContentWidth.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.22 Only available for backwards compatibility.
Do not use. Use secondaryContentSize instead.

value.!description: Defines the value of the text field of the item.

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

checkResize.!description: If set, the CalendarRow checks for resize by itself. If a lot of CalendarRow controls are used in one container control (like PlanningCalendar). the resize checks should be done only by this container control. Then the container control should call handleResize of the CalendarRow if a resize happens.

key.!description: Can be used as identifier of the appointment

enabled.!description: When an item is disabled the item can not be selected by the user. The enabled property of the item has no effect when the menu of the item is disabled ({@link sap.ui.unified.Menu#getEnabled Menu#getEnabled}).

iconHovered.!description: Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is hovered (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

text.!description: Defines the text which should be displayed on the item.

showWeekNumbers.!description: Determines whether the week numbers in the months are displayed. Note: For Islamic calendars, the week numbers are not displayed regardless of what is set to this property.

ariaDescription.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.27.0 Please use association ariaLabelledBy instead.
Accessible label / description of the menu for assistive technologies like screenreaders.

showSubIntervals.!description: If set, subintervals are shown. If the interval type is Hour, quarter hours are shown. If the interval type is Day, hours are shown. If the interval type is Month, days are shown.

appointmentsReducedHeight.!description: If set the appointments without text (only title) are rendered with a smaller height. Note: On phone devices this property is ignored, appointments are always rendered in full height to allow touching.

label.!description: Defines the label of the text field of the item.

sendXHR.!description: If set to "true", the request will be sent as XHR request instead of a form submit. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

updateCurrentTime.!description: If set the CalendarRow triggers a periodic update to visualize the current time. If a lot of CalendarRow controls are used in one container control (like PlanningCalendar) the periodic update should be triggered only by this container control. Then the container control should call updateCurrentTimeVisualization of the CalendarRow to update the visualization.

maximumFilenameLength.!description: The maximum length of a filename which the FileUploader will accept. If the maximum filename length is exceeded, the corresponding Event 'filenameLengthExceed' is fired.

maxDate.!description: Maximum date that can be shown and selected in the Calendar. This must be a JavaScript date object. Note: If the maxDate is set to be before the minDate, the minDate is set to the begin of the month of the maxDate.

items.!description: Number of time items displayed. Default is 12. Note: On phones, the maximum number of items displayed in the row is always 6.

colorString.!description:
Determines the input parameter that can be a string of type HEX, RGB, HSV, or a CSS color name:
  • HEX - #FFFFFF
  • RGB - rgb(255,255,255)
  • HSV - hsv(360,100,100)
  • CSS - red
Note: The output parameter is an RGB string of the current color.

tentative.!description: Indicates if the icon is tentative.

buttonText.!description: The Button text can be overwritten using this property.

iconOnly.!description: If set to true, the button is displayed without any text.

showEmptyIntervalHeaders.!description: If set, interval headers are shown even if no intervalHeaders are assigned to the visible time frame. If not set, no interval headers are shown if no intervalHeaders are assigned. Note: This property is only used if showIntervalHeaders is set to true.

showSeparator.!description: If set to true, a separator is displayed after the item.

showCurtain.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.3 Curtain is deprecated and replaced by ShellOverlay mechanism.
Shows / Hides the curtain.

primaryCalendarType.!description: If set, the calendar type is used for display. If not set, the calendar type of the global configuration is used.

selected.!description: Defines the toggle state in case the item represents a toggle button (see also property toggleEnabled).

intervalType.!description: Type of the intervals of the row. The default is one hour.

nonWorkingDays.!description: If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 6. (Other values will just be ignored.) If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days. Note: The non working days are only visualized if intervalType is set to day.

style.!description: Style of the button. "Transparent, "Accept", "Reject", or "Emphasized" is allowed.

name.!description: The name of the hidden inputfield.

columnWidth.!description: Defines the width of the created columns in which the items are arranged.

useSymbol.!description: Displays the currency symbol instead of the ISO currency code.

multiple.!description: Allows multiple files to be chosen and uploaded from the same folder. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

headerHiding.!description: Whether the header can be hidden (manually or automatically). This feature is only available when touch events are supported.

uploadUrl.!description: Used when URL address is on a remote server.

icon.!description: The icon of the item, either defined in the sap.ui.core.IconPool or a URI to a custom image. An icon must be set.

showIntervalHeaders.!description: If set, interval headers are shown like specified in showEmptyIntervalHeaders. If not set, no interval headers are shown even if intervalHeaders are assigned.

showDayNamesLine.!description: If set the day names are shown in a separate line. If not set the day names are shown inside the single days.

useMultipart.!description: If set to "false", the request will be sent as file only request instead of a multipart/form-data request. Only one file could be uploaded using this type of request. Required for sending such a request is to set the property "sendXHR" to "true". This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

additionalData.!description: Additional data that is sent to the back end service. Data will be transmitted as value of a hidden input where the name is derived from the name property with suffix -data.

secondaryContentSize.!description: The width if the secondary content. The height is always 100%.

months.!description: Number of months displayed Note: On phones, the maximum number of months displayed in the row is always 6.

intervalMinutes.!description: Size of on time interval in minutes, default is 60 minutes. Note: the start of the interval calculation is always on the corresponding date at 00:00. An interval longer than 720 minutes is not allowed. Please use the CalendarDateInterval instead. A day must be divisible by this interval size. One interval must not include more than one day.

color.!description: Overrides the color derived from the type property.

showPopupIndicator.!description: The user item is intended to be used for user settings. Normally these settings are done via a Menu or Dialog. If this property is set to true an indicator for such a popup mechanismn is shown in the item.

getText.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getText text}. Defines the text which should be displayed on the item. Default value is .

sap.ui.unified.MenuItem.!description: Standard item to be used inside a menu. A menu item represents an action which can be selected by the user in the menu or it can provide a submenu to organize the actions hierarchically.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.unified.MenuItem with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

setIcon.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getIcon icon}. Defines the icon of the {@link sap.ui.core.IconPool sap.ui.core.IconPool} or an image which should be displayed on the item. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is .

parameters.sIcon: type: sap.ui.core.URI, description: New value for property icon

sap.ui.unified.MenuItem.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new MenuItem element. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getText text} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: )
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase#constructor sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase} can be used as well.

setText.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getText text}. Defines the text which should be displayed on the item. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is .

parameters.sText: type: string, description: New value for property text

getIcon.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getIcon icon}. Defines the icon of the {@link sap.ui.core.IconPool sap.ui.core.IconPool} or an image which should be displayed on the item. Default value is .

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.unified.MenuItem.

sap.ui.unified.MenuItem.!helpDescription: Standard item to be used inside a menu. A menu item represents an action which can be selected by the user in the menu or it can provide a submenu to organize the actions hierarchically.

removeAllAriaLabelledBy.!description: Removes all the controls in the association named {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy}.

sap.ui.unified.ShellOverlay.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ShellOverlay. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
    • {@link #getSearch search} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Associations
    • {@link #getShell shell} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.unified.ShellLayout)
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:closed closed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getShell.!description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association {@link #getShell shell}, or null.

fireClosed.!description: Fires event {@link #event:closed closed} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

attachClosed.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:closed closed} event of this sap.ui.unified.ShellOverlay. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.unified.ShellOverlay itself. Fired when the overlay was closed.
attachClosed.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.unified.ShellOverlay

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.unified.ShellOverlay itself

addAriaLabelledBy.!description: Adds some ariaLabelledBy into the association {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy}.

parameters.vAriaLabelledBy: type: sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The ariaLabelledBy to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

sap.ui.unified.ShellOverlay.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.44.0 undefined
ShellOverlay to be opened in front of an sap.ui.unified.Shell

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The content to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the content should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the content is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the content is inserted at the last position

getSearch.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getSearch search}.

Experimental (This aggregation might change in future!): The search control which should be displayed in the overlay header.

destroySearch.!description: Destroys the search in the aggregation {@link #getSearch search}.

detachClosed.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:closed closed} event of this sap.ui.unified.ShellOverlay. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

parameters.oSearch: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The search to set

Deprecated! Since 1.44.0 undefined
ShellOverlay to be opened in front of an sap.ui.unified.Shell

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.unified.FileUploader itself. Event is fired when the file is allowed for upload on client side.

attachUploadComplete.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:uploadComplete uploadComplete} event of this sap.ui.unified.FileUploader. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.unified.FileUploader itself. Event is fired as soon as the upload request is completed (either successful or unsuccessful). To see if the upload request was successful, check the 'state' parameter for a value 2xx. The uploads actual progress can be retrieved via the 'uploadProgress' Event. However this covers only the client side of the Upload process and does not give any success status from the server.

getProcessedBlobsFromArray.!description: Allows to process Blobs before they get uploaded. This API can be used to create custom Blobs and upload these custom Blobs instead of the received/initials Blobs in the parameter aBlobs. One use case could be to create and upload zip archives based on the passed Blobs. The default implementation of this API should simply resolve with the received Blobs (parameter aBlobs). This API is only supported in case sendXHR is true. This means only IE10+ is supported, while IE9 and below is not. This is a default implementation of the interface sap.ui.unified.IProcessableBlobs.

parameters.aBlobs: type: [object Object][], description: The initial Blobs which can be used to determine/calculate a new array of Blobs for further processing.

sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.!helpDescription: The framework generates an input field and a button with text "Browse ...". The API supports features such as on change uploads (the upload starts immediately after a file has been selected), file uploads with explicit calls, adjustable control sizes, text display after uploads, or tooltips containing complete file paths.

removeAllParameters.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getParameters parameters}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

getMultiple.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getMultiple multiple}. Allows multiple files to be chosen and uploaded from the same folder. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9. Default value is false.

getEnabled.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnabled enabled}. Disabled controls have different colors, depending on customer settings. Default value is true.

fireTypeMissmatch.!description: Fires event {@link #event:typeMissmatch typeMissmatch} to attached listeners.

setIconHovered.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getIconHovered iconHovered}. Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is hovered (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is .

parameters.vParameter: type: int|string|sap.ui.unified.FileUploaderParameter, description: The parameter to remove or its index or id

getUploadUrl.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getUploadUrl uploadUrl}. Used when URL address is on a remote server. Default value is .

upload.!description: Starts the upload (as defined by uploadUrl)

parameters.bPreProcessFiles: type: boolean, description: Set to true to allow pre-processing of the files before sending the request. As a result, the upload method becomes asynchronous. See {@link sap.ui.unified.IProcessableBlobs} for more information. Note: This parameter is only taken into account when sendXHR is set to true.

getIcon.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getIcon icon}. Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button. This can be a URI to an image or an icon font URI. Default value is .

clear.!description: Clears the content of the FileUploader. The attached additional data however is retained.

getUseMultipart.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getUseMultipart useMultipart}. If set to "false", the request will be sent as file only request instead of a multipart/form-data request. Only one file could be uploaded using this type of request. Required for sending such a request is to set the property "sendXHR" to "true". This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9. Default value is true.

setPlaceholder.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder}. Placeholder for the text field. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sPlaceholder: type: string, description: New value for property placeholder

fireUploadComplete.!description: Fires event {@link #event:uploadComplete uploadComplete} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

setValueState.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getValueState valueState}. Visualizes warnings or errors related to the text field. Possible values: Warning, Error, Success, None. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is None.

parameters.sValueState: type: sap.ui.core.ValueState, description: New value for property valueState

setMaximumFileSize.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getMaximumFileSize maximumFileSize}. A file size limit in megabytes which prevents the upload if at least one file exceeds it. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.fMaximumFileSize: type: float, description: New value for property maximumFileSize

detachFilenameLengthExceed.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:filenameLengthExceed filenameLengthExceed} event of this sap.ui.unified.FileUploader. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

fireUploadStart.!description: Fires event {@link #event:uploadStart uploadStart} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

setValueStateText.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getValueStateText valueStateText}. Custom text for the value state message pop-up. Note: If not specified, a default text, based on the value state type, will be used instead. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sValueStateText: type: string, description: New value for property valueStateText

getStyle.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getStyle style}.

Style of the button. "Transparent, "Accept", "Reject", or "Emphasized" is allowed.

getPlaceholder.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder}.

Placeholder for the text field.

getMaximumFilenameLength.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getMaximumFilenameLength maximumFilenameLength}.

The maximum length of a filename which the FileUploader will accept. If the maximum filename length is exceeded, the corresponding Event 'filenameLengthExceed' is fired.

sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.!description: The framework generates an input field and a button with text "Browse ...". The API supports features such as on change uploads (the upload starts immediately after a file has been selected), file uploads with explicit calls, adjustable control sizes, text display after uploads, or tooltips containing complete file paths.

getButtonOnly.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getButtonOnly buttonOnly}. If set to "true", the FileUploader will be rendered as Button only, without showing the InputField. Default value is false.

setUploadUrl.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getUploadUrl uploadUrl}. Used when URL address is on a remote server. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is .

parameters.sUploadUrl: type: sap.ui.core.URI, description: New value for property uploadUrl

getIconFirst.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getIconFirst iconFirst}. If set to true (default), the display sequence is 1. icon 2. control text. Default value is true.

getName.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getName name}.

Unique control name for identification on the server side after sending data to the server.

fireUploadAborted.!description: Fires event {@link #event:uploadAborted uploadAborted} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

setUseMultipart.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getUseMultipart useMultipart}. If set to "false", the request will be sent as file only request instead of a multipart/form-data request. Only one file could be uploaded using this type of request. Required for sending such a request is to set the property "sendXHR" to "true". This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bUseMultipart: type: boolean, description: New value for property useMultipart

fireUploadProgress.!description: Fires event {@link #event:uploadProgress uploadProgress} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

getUploadOnChange.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getUploadOnChange uploadOnChange}. If set to "true", the upload immediately starts after file selection. With the default setting, the upload needs to be explicitly triggered. Default value is false.

getHeaderParameters.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getHeaderParameters headerParameters}.

The header parameters for the FileUploader which are only submitted with XHR requests. Header parameters are not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

insertParameter.!description: Inserts a parameter into the aggregation {@link #getParameters parameters}.

parameters.oParameter: type: sap.ui.unified.FileUploaderParameter, description: The parameter to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the parameter should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the parameter is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the parameter is inserted at the last position

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.

getIconSelected.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getIconSelected iconSelected}. Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is selected (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base or hovered icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored. Default value is .

setMultiple.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getMultiple multiple}. Allows multiple files to be chosen and uploaded from the same folder. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bMultiple: type: boolean, description: New value for property multiple

detachFileSizeExceed.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:fileSizeExceed fileSizeExceed} event of this sap.ui.unified.FileUploader. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

setFileType.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getFileType fileType}. The chosen files will be checked against an array of file types. If at least one file does not fit the file type restriction the upload is prevented. Example: ["jpg", "png", "bmp"]. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sFileType: type: [object Object][], description: New value for property fileType

getFileType.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getFileType fileType}.

The chosen files will be checked against an array of file types. If at least one file does not fit the file type restriction the upload is prevented. Example: ["jpg", "png", "bmp"].

setIconOnly.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getIconOnly iconOnly}. If set to true, the button is displayed without any text. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bIconOnly: type: boolean, description: New value for property iconOnly

getWidth.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}. Specifies the displayed control width. Default value is .

addHeaderParameter.!description: Adds some headerParameter to the aggregation {@link #getHeaderParameters headerParameters}.

parameters.oHeaderParameter: type: sap.ui.unified.FileUploaderParameter, description: The headerParameter to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

getIconOnly.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getIconOnly iconOnly}. If set to true, the button is displayed without any text. Default value is false.

sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FileUploader. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getValue value} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUploadUrl uploadUrl} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: )
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: )
    • {@link #getUploadOnChange uploadOnChange} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAdditionalData additionalData} : string
    • {@link #getSameFilenameAllowed sameFilenameAllowed} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getButtonText buttonText} : string
    • {@link #getFileType fileType} : string[]
    • {@link #getMultiple multiple} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMaximumFileSize maximumFileSize} : float
    • {@link #getMimeType mimeType} : string[]
    • {@link #getSendXHR sendXHR} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder} : string
    • {@link #getStyle style} : string
    • {@link #getButtonOnly buttonOnly} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getUseMultipart useMultipart} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMaximumFilenameLength maximumFilenameLength} : int
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getValueStateText valueStateText} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: )
    • {@link #getIconHovered iconHovered} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: )
    • {@link #getIconSelected iconSelected} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: )
    • {@link #getIconFirst iconFirst} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getIconOnly iconOnly} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getParameters parameters} : sap.ui.unified.FileUploaderParameter[]
    • {@link #getHeaderParameters headerParameters} : sap.ui.unified.FileUploaderParameter[]
    • {@link #getXhrSettings xhrSettings} : sap.ui.unified.FileUploaderXHRSettings
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:uploadComplete uploadComplete} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:typeMissmatch typeMissmatch} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:fileSizeExceed fileSizeExceed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:fileAllowed fileAllowed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:uploadProgress uploadProgress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:uploadAborted uploadAborted} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:filenameLengthExceed filenameLengthExceed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:uploadStart uploadStart} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

setMimeType.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getMimeType mimeType}. The chosen files will be checked against an array of mime types. If at least one file does not fit the mime type restriction the upload is prevented. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9. Example: mimeType ["image/png", "image/jpeg"]. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sMimeType: type: [object Object][], description: New value for property mimeType

fireChange.!description: Fires event {@link #event:change change} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

getSameFilenameAllowed.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSameFilenameAllowed sameFilenameAllowed}. If the FileUploader is configured to upload the file directly after the file is selected it is not allowed to upload a file with the same name again. If a user should be allowed to upload a file with the same name again this parameter has to be "true". A typical use case would be if the files have different paths. Default value is false.

indexOfParameter.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.unified.FileUploaderParameter in the aggregation {@link #getParameters parameters}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oParameter: type: sap.ui.unified.FileUploaderParameter, description: The parameter whose index is looked for

setIcon.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getIcon icon}. Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button. This can be a URI to an image or an icon font URI. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is .

parameters.sIcon: type: sap.ui.core.URI, description: New value for property icon

setName.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getName name}. Unique control name for identification on the server side after sending data to the server. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sName: type: string, description: New value for property name

setAdditionalData.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getAdditionalData additionalData}. Additional data that is sent to the back end service. Data will be transmitted as value of a hidden input where the name is derived from the name property with suffix -data. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sAdditionalData: type: string, description: New value for property additionalData

getMimeType.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getMimeType mimeType}.

The chosen files will be checked against an array of mime types. If at least one file does not fit the mime type restriction the upload is prevented. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9. Example: mimeType ["image/png", "image/jpeg"].

getValue.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getValue value}. Value of the path for file upload. Default value is .

detachTypeMissmatch.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:typeMissmatch typeMissmatch} event of this sap.ui.unified.FileUploader. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

indexOfHeaderParameter.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.unified.FileUploaderParameter in the aggregation {@link #getHeaderParameters headerParameters}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oHeaderParameter: type: sap.ui.unified.FileUploaderParameter, description: The headerParameter whose index is looked for

attachTypeMissmatch.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:typeMissmatch typeMissmatch} event of this sap.ui.unified.FileUploader. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.unified.FileUploader itself. Event is fired when the type of a file does not match the mimeType or fileType property.

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.unified.FileUploader itself

insertHeaderParameter.!description: Inserts a headerParameter into the aggregation {@link #getHeaderParameters headerParameters}.

parameters.oHeaderParameter: type: sap.ui.unified.FileUploaderParameter, description: The headerParameter to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the headerParameter should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the headerParameter is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the headerParameter is inserted at the last position

getValueState.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getValueState valueState}. Visualizes warnings or errors related to the text field. Possible values: Warning, Error, Success, None. Default value is None.

setSameFilenameAllowed.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSameFilenameAllowed sameFilenameAllowed}. If the FileUploader is configured to upload the file directly after the file is selected it is not allowed to upload a file with the same name again. If a user should be allowed to upload a file with the same name again this parameter has to be "true". A typical use case would be if the files have different paths. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bSameFilenameAllowed: type: boolean, description: New value for property sameFilenameAllowed

attachUploadAborted.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:uploadAborted uploadAborted} event of this sap.ui.unified.FileUploader. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.unified.FileUploader itself. Event is fired after the current upload has been aborted. This is event is only supported with property sendXHR set to true, i.e. the event is not supported in Internet Explorer 9.

Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is hovered (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored. Default value is .

parameters.bEnabled: type: boolean, description: New value for property enabled

getSendXHR.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSendXHR sendXHR}. If set to "true", the request will be sent as XHR request instead of a form submit. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9. Default value is false.

attachUploadProgress.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:uploadProgress uploadProgress} event of this sap.ui.unified.FileUploader. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.unified.FileUploader itself. Event is fired after the upload has started and before the upload is completed and contains progress information related to the running upload. Depending on file size, band width and used browser the event is fired once or multiple times. This is event is only supported with property sendXHR set to true, i.e. the event is not supported in Internet Explorer 9.

sap.ui.unified.ShellHeadItem.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ShellHeadItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getStartsSection startsSection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowSeparator showSeparator} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSelected selected} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getToggleEnabled toggleEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowMarker showMarker} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.unified.ShellHeadItem itself. Event is fired when the user presses the item.

sap.ui.unified.CalendarRow.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new CalendarRow. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getStartDate startDate} : object
    • {@link #getIntervals intervals} : int (default: 12)
    • {@link #getIntervalType intervalType} : sap.ui.unified.CalendarIntervalType (default: Hour)
    • {@link #getShowSubIntervals showSubIntervals} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowIntervalHeaders showIntervalHeaders} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowEmptyIntervalHeaders showEmptyIntervalHeaders} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getNonWorkingDays nonWorkingDays} : int[]
    • {@link #getNonWorkingHours nonWorkingHours} : int[]
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getCheckResize checkResize} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUpdateCurrentTime updateCurrentTime} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getGroupAppointmentsMode groupAppointmentsMode} : sap.ui.unified.GroupAppointmentsMode (default: Collapsed)
    • {@link #getAppointmentsReducedHeight appointmentsReducedHeight} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAppointmentsVisualization appointmentsVisualization} : sap.ui.unified.CalendarAppointmentVisualization (default: Standard)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getAppointments appointments} : sap.ui.unified.CalendarAppointment[]
    • {@link #getIntervalHeaders intervalHeaders} : sap.ui.unified.CalendarAppointment[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.unified.CalendarLegend)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:startDateChange startDateChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:leaveRow leaveRow} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:intervalSelect intervalSelect} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getAppointmentsVisualization.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getAppointmentsVisualization appointmentsVisualization}. Defines the visualization of the CalendarAppoinment Note: The real visualization depends on the used theme. Default value is Standard.

addAriaLabelledBy.!description: Adds some ariaLabelledBy into the association {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy}.

parameters.vAriaLabelledBy: type: sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The ariaLabelledBy to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

getIntervalHeaders.!description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getIntervalHeaders intervalHeaders}. Appointments to be displayed in the top of the intervals. The intervalHeaders are used to visualize public holidays and similar things. Appointments outside the visible time frame are not rendered. The intervalHeaders always fill whole intervals. If they are shorter than one interval, they are not displayed. Note: For performance reasons, only appointments in the visible time range or nearby should be assigned.

fireLeaveRow.!description: Fires event {@link #event:leaveRow leaveRow} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

setHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHeight height}. Height of the row When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sHeight: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property height

removeAllAppointments.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getAppointments appointments}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

setNonWorkingDays.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getNonWorkingDays nonWorkingDays}. If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 6. (Other values will just be ignored.) If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days. Note: The non working days are only visualized if intervalType is set to day. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sNonWorkingDays: type: [object Object][], description: New value for property nonWorkingDays

setCheckResize.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getCheckResize checkResize}. If set, the CalendarRow checks for resize by itself. If a lot of CalendarRow controls are used in one container control (like PlanningCalendar). the resize checks should be done only by this container control. Then the container control should call handleResize of the CalendarRow if a resize happens. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bCheckResize: type: boolean, description: New value for property checkResize

sap.ui.unified.CalendarRow.!helpDescription: A calendar row with a header and appointments. The Appointments will be placed in the defined interval.

setUpdateCurrentTime.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getUpdateCurrentTime updateCurrentTime}. If set the CalendarRow triggers a periodic update to visualize the current time. If a lot of CalendarRow controls are used in one container control (like PlanningCalendar) the periodic update should be triggered only by this container control. Then the container control should call updateCurrentTimeVisualization of the CalendarRow to update the visualization. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bUpdateCurrentTime: type: boolean, description: New value for property updateCurrentTime

detachStartDateChange.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:startDateChange startDateChange} event of this sap.ui.unified.CalendarRow. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

parameters.oAppointment: type: sap.ui.unified.CalendarAppointment, description: The appointment whose index is looked for

setShowSubIntervals.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowSubIntervals showSubIntervals}. If set, subintervals are shown. If the interval type is Hour, quarter hours are shown. If the interval type is Day, hours are shown. If the interval type is Month, days are shown. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bShowSubIntervals: type: boolean, description: New value for property showSubIntervals

getGroupAppointmentsMode.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getGroupAppointmentsMode groupAppointmentsMode}. Defines the mode in which the overlapping appointments are displayed. Note: This property takes effect, only if the intervalType of the current calendar view is set to sap.ui.unified.CalendarIntervalType.Month. On phone devices this property is ignored, and the default value is applied. Default value is Collapsed.

getShowEmptyIntervalHeaders.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowEmptyIntervalHeaders showEmptyIntervalHeaders}. If set, interval headers are shown even if no intervalHeaders are assigned to the visible time frame. If not set, no interval headers are shown if no intervalHeaders are assigned. Note: This property is only used if showIntervalHeaders is set to true. Default value is true.

setNonWorkingHours.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getNonWorkingHours nonWorkingHours}. If set, the provided hours are displayed as non-working hours. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 23. (Other values will just be ignored.) Note: The non working hours are only visualized if intervalType is set to hour. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sNonWorkingHours: type: [object Object][], description: New value for property nonWorkingHours

sap.ui.unified.calendar.TimesRow.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new TimesRow. It shows a calendar with time granularity (normally hours) Note: This is used inside the CalendarTimeInterval, not for standalone usage. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDate date} : object
    • {@link #getStartDate startDate} : object
    • {@link #getItems items} : int (default: 12)
    • {@link #getIntervalMinutes intervalMinutes} : int (default: 60)
    • {@link #getIntervalSelection intervalSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSingleSelection singleSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowHeader showHeader} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSelectedDates selectedDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateRange[]
    • {@link #getSpecialDates specialDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.unified.CalendarLegend)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:focus focus} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getColorString.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getColorString colorString}. Determines the input parameter that can be a string of type HEX, RGB, HSV, or a CSS color name:
  • HEX - #FFFFFF
  • RGB - rgb(255,255,255)
  • HSV - hsv(360,100,100)
  • CSS - red
Note: The output parameter is an RGB string of the current color.

sap.ui.unified.calendar.Header.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Header. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTextButton0 textButton0} : string
    • {@link #getAdditionalTextButton0 additionalTextButton0} : string
    • {@link #getAriaLabelButton0 ariaLabelButton0} : string
    • {@link #getVisibleButton0 visibleButton0} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTextButton1 textButton1} : string
    • {@link #getAdditionalTextButton1 additionalTextButton1} : string
    • {@link #getAriaLabelButton1 ariaLabelButton1} : string
    • {@link #getVisibleButton1 visibleButton1} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getTextButton2 textButton2} : string
    • {@link #getAdditionalTextButton2 additionalTextButton2} : string
    • {@link #getAriaLabelButton2 ariaLabelButton2} : string
    • {@link #getVisibleButton2 visibleButton2} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnabledPrevious enabledPrevious} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnabledNext enabledNext} : boolean (default: true)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:pressPrevious pressPrevious} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:pressNext pressNext} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:pressButton0 pressButton0} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:pressButton1 pressButton1} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:pressButton2 pressButton2} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.unified.CalendarMonthInterval.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new CalendarMonthInterval. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getStartDate startDate} : object
    • {@link #getIntervalSelection intervalSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSingleSelection singleSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMonths months} : int (default: 12)
    • {@link #getPickerPopup pickerPopup} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMinDate minDate} : object
    • {@link #getMaxDate maxDate} : object
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSelectedDates selectedDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateRange[]
    • {@link #getSpecialDates specialDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.unified.CalendarLegend)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:cancel cancel} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:startDateChange startDateChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

Note: If the maxDate is set to be before the minDate, the minDate is set to the begin of the month of the maxDate. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.oMaxDate: type: object, description: New value for property maxDate

If a Date object is returned the date will be set to the 1st of the corresponding month.

sap.ui.unified.calendar.DatesRow.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new calendar/DatesRow. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getStartDate startDate} : object
    • {@link #getDays days} : int (default: 7)
    • {@link #getShowDayNamesLine showDayNamesLine} : boolean (default: true)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.unified.calendar.Month#constructor sap.ui.unified.calendar.Month} can be used as well.

setDate.!description: Setter for property date. Property date date to be focused or displayed. It must be in the displayed date range beginning with startDate and days days So set this properties before setting the date.

parameters.oDate: type: object, description: JavaScript date object for start date.

sap.ui.unified.calendar.DatesRow.!description: renders a row of days with ItemNavigation This is used inside the calendar. Not for stand alone usage If used inside the calendar the properties and aggregation are directly taken from the parent (To not duplicate and sync DateRanges and so on...)

setDays.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDays days}. number of days displayed When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 7.

parameters.iDays: type: int, description: New value for property days

getShowDayNamesLine.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowDayNamesLine showDayNamesLine}. If set the day names are shown in a separate line. If not set the day names are shown inside the single days. Default value is true.

getDays.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDays days}. number of days displayed Default value is 7.

getStartDate.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getStartDate startDate}.

Start date of the row If in rendering phase the date property is not in the range startDate + days, it is set to the start date So after setting the start date the date should be set to be in the range of the start date

setStartDate.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getStartDate startDate}. Start date of the row If in rendering phase the date property is not in the range startDate + days, it is set to the start date So after setting the start date the date should be set to be in the range of the start date When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.oStartDate: type: object, description: New value for property startDate

setShowDayNamesLine.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowDayNamesLine showDayNamesLine}. If set the day names are shown in a separate line. If not set the day names are shown inside the single days. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bShowDayNamesLine: type: boolean, description: New value for property showDayNamesLine

setFirstDayOfWeek.!description: Setter for property firstDayOfWeek. Property firstDayOfWeek is not supported in sap.ui.unified.calendar.DatesRow control.

parameters.iFirstDayOfWeek: type: int, description: The first day of the week

sap.ui.unified.calendar.DatesRow.!helpDescription: renders a row of days with ItemNavigation This is used inside the calendar. Not for stand alone usage If used inside the calendar the properties and aggregation are directly taken from the parent (To not duplicate and sync DateRanges and so on...)

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.unified.calendar.DatesRow.

ZoomIn.!description: The new content is "zoomed in" from the center and grows to fill the full content area.

SlideRight.!description: The new slides in from the left (to the right).

ZoomOut.!description: The old content is "zoomed out", i.e. shrinks to a point at the center of the content area.

Rotate.!description: The new content rotates in. (Just like one of those old newspaper-animations.)

None.!description: No animation. Content is switched instantly.

SlideOver.!description: The new content slides in from the left while the old content slides out to the left at the same time.

setPageSize.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getPageSize pageSize}. The keyboard can be used to navigate through the items of a menu. Beside the arrow keys for single steps and the Home / End keys for jumping to the first / last item, the Page Up / Page Down keys can be used to jump an arbitrary number of items up or down. This number can be defined via the pageSize property. For values smaller than 1, paging behaves in a similar way to when using the Home / End keys. If the value equals 1, the paging behavior is similar to that of the arrow keys. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 5.

parameters.iPageSize: type: int, description: New value for property pageSize

open.!description:
Opens the menu at the specified position.

The position of the menu is defined relative to an element in the visible DOM by specifying the docking location of the menu and of the related element.

See {@link sap.ui.core.Popup#open Popup#open} for further details about popup positioning.
open.!type: fn(bWithKeyboard: Boolean, oOpenerRef: sap.ui.core.Element | DOMRef, my: sap.ui.core.Dock, at: sap.ui.core.Dock, of: sap.ui.core.Element | DOMRef, offset?: String, collision?: sap.ui.core.Collision)

parameters.of: type: sap.ui.core.Element|DOMRef, description: The menu is positioned relatively to this element based on the given dock locations
parameters.oOpenerRef: type: sap.ui.core.Element|DOMRef, description: The element which will get the focus back again after the menu was closed
parameters.at: type: sap.ui.core.Dock, description: The 'of' element's reference docking location for positioning the menu on the screen
parameters.bWithKeyboard: type: boolean, description: Indicates whether or not the first item shall be highlighted when the menu is opened (keyboard case)
parameters.offset: type: string, description: The offset relative to the docking point, specified as a string with space-separated pixel values (e.g. "0 10" to move the popup 10 pixels to the right)
parameters.my: type: sap.ui.core.Dock, description: The reference docking location of the menu for positioning the menu on the screen
parameters.collision: type: sap.ui.core.Collision, description: The collision defines how the position of the menu should be adjusted in case it overflows the window in some direction

getAriaDescription.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.27.0 Please use association ariaLabelledBy instead.
Gets current value of property {@link #getAriaDescription ariaDescription}. Accessible label / description of the menu for assistive technologies like screenreaders.

setMaxVisibleItems.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getMaxVisibleItems maxVisibleItems}. The maximum number of items which are displayed before an overflow mechanism takes effect. A value smaller than 1 means an infinite number of visible items. The overall height of the menu is limited by the height of the screen. If the maximum possible height is reached, an overflow takes effect, even if the maximum number of visible items is not yet reached. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

parameters.iMaxVisibleItems: type: int, description: New value for property maxVisibleItems

setEnabled.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnabled enabled}. When a menu is disabled none of its items can be selected by the user. The enabled property of an item (@link sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase#getEnabled) has no effect when the menu of the item is disabled. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bEnabled: type: boolean, description: New value for property enabled

attachItemSelect.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:itemSelect itemSelect} event of this sap.ui.unified.Menu. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.unified.Menu itself. Fired on the root menu of a menu hierarchy whenever a user selects an item within the menu or within one of its direct or indirect submenus. Note: There is also a select event available for each single menu item. This event and the event of the menu items are redundant.
